data.title: Centre College faculty and staff awards announced
data.snippet:
Sara Egge, Professor of History
 Aaron Godlaski, Professor of Psychology and Neuroscience
 Jennifer Goetz, Professor of Psychology
 Lee Jefferson, Professor of Religion
 James Kelly, Professor of Physics
 Stacey Peebles, Professor of English
 David Toth, Professor of Computer Science and Data Science
 Ravi Radhakrishnan, Professor of Economics and Business

Two assistant professors were promoted to the rank of associate professor.

 Marc Démont, Associate Professor of French
 Brian Rogers, Associate Professor of Economics and Business

Six faculty members were also distinguished as Centre Scholars, an award that recognizes excellence in teaching, scholarly work and contributions to the college community. [...] The College recognized facilities employees for outstanding achievement in the department with the Horky Service Award, created in 1990 after a bequest by Lorette and John Horky ’32.

This year’s Horky Award winners were Grounds Operations Leader Aaron Bruner and Custodian Ricky Reynolds.

Four staff members received Recognition Awards, honoring those who go above and beyond to make outstanding contributions to the College: Executive Administrative Assistant to the Vice President and Dean of Student Life Anita Bertram, Administrative Assistant for Division III Nancy Harrison, Associate Director of International Recruitment Joy Joy Htet and Associate Director of Design for Brand and Stewardship Communications Tom Sturgeon. [...] Skip to main site navigation

ApplyRequest InformationVisit

1. News
2. Centre celebrates end of year with honors for outstanding faculty and staff

# Centre celebrates end of year with honors for outstanding faculty and staff

Centre College News

 Campus News
 Faculty & Staff Support
 Teaching & Learning
 Awards & Honors

Centre College celebrated its faculty and staff at the end of the year with awards highlighting their ongoing commitment to the College’s mission of preparing students for lives of learning, leadership and service.

Three professors were given the Kirk Award, which was established in 1996 to honor faculty whose teaching was recognized as outstanding during annual review. The 2025 Kirk Award winners are:

Division I

Helen Emmitt, J. Rice Cowan Professor of English

data.title: Prizes and Awards - Centre College - smartcatalogiq.com
data.snippet:
The Student Life Leadership Award, given by Dr. Jeff Johnson, Class of 1995, in honor of past, present, and future professional student life staff educators to a senior student who has demonstrated a robust and consistent commitment to student activities, campus life, and leadership. Selected by the professional staff of the Student Life Office from students nominated by faculty, staff and students. While academic standing is not a selection criterion, the student should have a minimum GPA of 2.5. [...] The T. Hunton Rogers Memorial Scholarship Prize, established in memory of T. Hunton Rogers, trustee emeritus, presented to a junior who excels in physical science studies, to be applied toward tuition for the senior year.

The Nayef Samhat Prize Fund, established in honor of former faculty member, Dr. Nayef Samhat, to recognize the graduating senior majoring in international studies judged by the program faculty to have shown the greatest promise to advance peace and justice in international affairs.

The Sociology Prize, awarded to an outstanding senior sociology major. [...] The Organic Chemistry Award, established by the American Chemical Society, Division of Polymer Chemistry, Inc., awarded to the student who exhibits outstanding performance in the study of organic chemistry.

The James Ware Parrish II English Prize, awarded to the student submitting the best independent study in the field of British and/or American literature.

The Psychology Prize, awarded to an outstanding psychology major.

The John W. Redd English Prize, established by Mrs. John W. Redd, awarded to the two first-year students submitting the best English papers to the English Program Committee.

Zak French Dr. [...] Philosophy Prize, awarded to a senior of high moral character who has done outstanding work in philosophy courses. ►Weston Lee Brown The Marshall Wilt Physics Prize, awarded to an outstanding physics major. ►Christian Ferrell Fronk The Psychology Prize, awarded to an outstanding psychology major. ►Courtney Renee Evans and Jayla Renee Truth Johnson The Behavioral Neuroscience Prize, awarded to an outstanding behavioral neuroscience major. ►Kelsey Rae Jenks The John Barbour Memorial Prize, awarded to the student receiving the highest grade in the study of the Bible or biblical literature. ►Joshua Daniel Sto Domingo The Samuel Robertson Cheek Honor Scholarship, presented to a junior who is judged to be the most outstanding in required Bible courses. ►William Tanner Ray and Kevli Paresh Sheth [...] senior who plans to pursue a career in law or education and has at least a 3.0 grade point average. ►Kemmara Jada Bailey The Robert Dale Holmes Memorial Prize, presented to the first-year student who, by the improvement of their work, diligence, and character, reveals most clearly the value of college training and the spirit of the College. ►Temesgen Yonas Kahsay The Alumnae Association Prize, awarded to a sophomore who clearly shows the academic and personal standards of Centre College. ►Sarah Elaine Koch The Richard Stanford Watson, Jr. Memorial Award, presented to a sophomore who exemplifies campus citizenship of the highest order. ►Louis Ene Okon The John Howard Duff, Jr. Memorial Prize, presented to an outstanding junior exemplifying participation in all aspects of Centre College
